channel.title: The New Yorker — Reporting
channel.description: Latest reporting from The New Yorker

item.title: My House Burned in the L.A. Fires. What Happens Now?
item.description: A devastated community fights for rebirth.

item.title: Have Cubans Fled One Authoritarian State for Another?
item.description: In the past few years, as many as two million people have escaped the island’s repressive regime and collapsing economy. Those who’ve made it to the U.S. face a new reckoning.

item.title: Carol Burnett Plays On
item.description: The ninety-two-year-old comedy legend has influenced generations of performers. In a string of recent TV roles, she has been co-starring with some of her closest comedic heirs.

item.title: Tim Berners-Lee Invented the World Wide Web. Now He Wants to Save It
item.description: In 1989, Sir Tim revolutionized the online world. Today, in the era of misinformation, addictive algorithms, and extractive monopolies, he thinks he can do it again.

item.title: Glowworms
item.description: In the punt on the river in the cave, beneath the dim light of glowing worms, it was thoughts of my own death that consumed me.

item.title: The Hague on Trial
item.description: The chief prosecutor has obtained warrants against Israeli leaders for war crimes—but faces allegations of sexual misconduct.

item.title: Keri Russell’s Emotional Transparency Has Anchored Three Decades of TV
item.description: But, offscreen, she’s not even sure that she wants to be an actress.

item.title: A Year of Convulsions in New York’s Prisons
item.description: How two murders and a strike exposed a system at its breaking point.

item.title: The Prime Minister Who Tried to Have a Life Outside the Office
item.description: As the thirtysomething leader of Finland, Sanna Marin pursued an ambitious policy agenda. The press focussed on her nights out and how she paid for breakfast.

item.title: What Zohran Mamdani Knows About Power
item.description: The thirty-three-year-old socialist is rewriting the rules of New York politics. Can he transform the city as mayor?
